column1: #Text=Polycrystalline samples of CoxZnyMnz (x+y+z=20) were synthesized by the method described in ref. 29.

#Text=Stoichiometric amounts of pure Co, Zn and Mn pieces of 2 g total mass were sealed in evacuated quartz tubes (∼10−3 Pa), heated to 1,000 °C for 12 h, followed by slow cooling (1 °C h−1) down to 925 °C, then kept at this temperature for 75–100 h.

#Text=A polycrystalline sample of Co8Zn8Mn4 with larger grain sizes (typically up to 3 mm) was grown by the Bridgman method with cooling from 1,025 °C to ∼700 °C over 1 week, followed by water quench.
#Text=A single-crystalline specimen was cut out from the resultant product and oriented with use of back-reflection X-ray Laue photographs.
